section.para: A Financing Request or Trade Financing (TF) is a transaction issued in the by the client and sent to a designated bank (the lender, also called Issuing Bank of the loan in the rest of this document) whereby that import or export customer requests some form of financing for an International Trade transaction.

The use of the Financing Requests module is quite generic in the sense that it aims at providing transaction handling capabilities for various types of financing such as Import Loans, Export Discounts on a presentation of documents by an exporter, as well as Trust Receipts or for instance Export Pre-Financing.

To illustrate a possible use of this module, take the example of a Trust Receipt where the customer/importer is unable to pay for the cost of goods imported according to the terms of a Documentary Collection or even a Letter of Credit, and it is necessary for him to sell the goods first.

In such a case, the Financing Requests module would be used by the customer to submit his request by specifying the expected maturity date, the amount of the sale and the schedule of the goods whose possession is held by the bank under this Trust Receipt agreement.

For an Export Pre-Financing or a Packing Credit, an exporter could typically use the module to submit his request for financing and specify its maturity date, amount and typically the details of the invoices to finance.

This module enables you, on behalf of your company, to initiate new requests, send them to your chosen Issuing Bank, and subsequently follow up these transactions by sending and receiving updates on the records to and from the bank.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, the terms "TF" and "Financing Request" are used interchangeably. Also "LC" and "Letter of Credit" are used interchangeably. The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Financing Request - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Financing Request function, from the toolbar, select Trade Services > Financing Request.

section.title: Financing Request Functions
section.para: The menu for this module has the following groups of functions. All are basically as described in the chapter Functions, but TF Initiate and Update TF differ in some ways from the Initiate and Amendment described in that chapter. There is no Message to Bank - you use Update TF to send a free-format message to the bank.

section.title: TF General - Edit Transactions
section.para: This option allows Financing Request records that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of Financing Request records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges.
Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing.

section.title: TF General - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows a Financing Request record that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of Financing Request records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click in the System Id column to open the record in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: TF Maintenance
section.para: This function is user to maintain Financing Request records that were created, but are no longer required in the system.

section.title: TF Maintenance - Set Entity
section.para: List all Financing Request transactions and associate an Entity. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click Set Entity and then select System ID. You can now set an entity for the Financing Request transactions by clicking the search icon
from the Entity field. Click the Submit button to complete the changes.

section.title: TF Maintenance - Set Reference
section.para: Assign a customer reference to a Financing Request transaction that currently has none.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that have no reference assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign a reference to the record.

note.para: This action is not validated against the Jurisdiction matrix. All transactions of the current files are updated.

section.title: TF Maintenance - Unsigned TFs
section.para: List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) Financing Request transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that are unsigned (unauthorised). You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: TF Maintenance - Purged TFs
section.para: List and optionally delete Financing Request transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: TF Maintenance - Rejected TFs
section.para: List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of Financing Request records that were submitted, but rejected by the bank and have a status of "Not Processed". You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
